question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Which of the following functions have inverses?  Note that the domain of each function is also given.

A. $a(x) = \sqrt{2 - x},$ $x \in (-\infty,2].$

B. $b(x) = x^3 - x,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

C. $c(x) = x + \frac{1}{x},$ $x \in (0,\infty).$

D. $d(x) = 2x^2 + 4x + 7,$ $x \in [0,\infty).$

E. $e(x) = |x - 2| + |x + 3|,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

F. $f(x) = 3^x + 7^x,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

G. $g(x) = x - \frac{1}{x},$ $x \in (0,\infty).$

H. $h(x) = \frac{x}{2},$ $x \in [-2,7).$

Enter the letters of the functions that have inverses, separated by commas.  For example, if you think functions $b(x)$ and $e(x)$ have inverses, enter "B, E" without the quotation marks.
inference:
A function has an inverse if it is one-to-one.  To determine this, we can use the horizontal line test.  If any horizontal line intersects the graph of the function more than once, then the function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

A. $a(x) = \sqrt{2 - x},$ $x \in (-\infty,2].$

The graph of this function is the right half of a parabola.  Any horizontal line that intersects the graph between $x=-2$ and $x=2$ will intersect the graph twice.  Therefore, this function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

B. $b(x) = x^3 - x,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

The graph of this function is a cubic.  Any horizontal line will intersect the graph at most once.  Therefore, this function is one-to-one and has an inverse.

C. $c(x) = x + \frac{1}{x},$ $x \in (0,\infty).$

The graph of this function is a hyperbola.  Any horizontal line that intersects the graph between $x=0$ and $x=\infty$ will intersect the graph twice.  Therefore, this function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

D. $d(x) = 2x^2 + 4x + 7,$ $x \in [0,\infty).$

The graph of this function is a parabola.  Any horizontal line that intersects the graph between $x=0$ and $x=\infty$ will intersect the graph twice.  Therefore, this function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

E. $e(x) = |x - 2| + |x + 3|,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

The graph of this function is a V-shape.  Any horizontal line that intersects the graph between $x=-3$ and $x=2$ will intersect the graph twice.  Therefore, this function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

F. $f(x) = 3^x + 7^x,$ $x \in \mathbb{R}.$

The graph of this function is an exponential curve.  Any horizontal line will intersect the graph at most once.  Therefore, this function is one-to-one and has an inverse.

G. $g(x) = x - \frac{1}{x},$ $x \in (0,\infty).$

The graph of this function is a hyperbola.  Any horizontal line that intersects the graph between $x=0$ and $x=\infty$ will intersect the graph twice.  Therefore, this function is not one-to-one and does not have an inverse.

H. $h(x) = \frac{x}{2},$ $x \in [-2,7).$

The graph of this function is a line.  Any horizontal line will intersect the graph at most once.  Therefore, this function is one-to-one and has an inverse.

Therefore, the functions that have inverses are B, F, and H.

Final Answer:  $\boxed{B,F,H}$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
A. The function $a(x) = \sqrt{2 - x}$ is decreasing, so it has an inverse.

B. Note that $b(0) = b(1) = 0,$ so the function $b(x)$ does not have an inverse.

C. Note that $c \left( \frac{1}{2} \right) = c(2) = \frac{5}{2},$ so the function $c(x)$ does not have an inverse.

D. The function $d(x) = 2x^2 + 4x + 7 = 2(x + 1)^2 + 5$ is increasing on $[0,\infty),$ so it has an inverse.

E. Note that $e(2) = e(-3) = 5,$ so the function $e(x)$ does not have an inverse.

F. Both $3^x$ and $7^x$ are increasing, so $f(x) = 3^x + 7^x$ is also increasing.  Hence, it has an inverse.

G. Suppose $g(a) = g(b)$ for some $a,$ $b > 0.$  Then
\[a - \frac{1}{a} = b - \frac{1}{b}.\]Multiplying both sides by $ab,$ we get
\[a^2 b - b = ab^2 - a.\]Then $a^2 b - ab^2 + a - b = 0,$ which factors as $(a - b)(ab + 1) = 0.$  Since $a$ and $b$ are positive, $ab + 1$ cannot be 0, so $a = b.$

We have shown that $g(a) = g(b)$ forces $a = b,$ so the function $g(x)$ has an inverse.

H. The function $h(x) = \frac{x}{2}$ has an inverse, namely $h^{-1}(x) = 2x.$

Thus, the letters of the functions that have inverses are $\boxed{\text{A, D, F, G, H}}.$
